channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: @kevinhughes i have a lot of computers. ;-)

1/7 So much disappointment in what Biden said about Putin. As I've said, I don't care. Putin has to go, whether or not Biden said it out loud.
2/7 But there's a much more dangerous despot-in-waiting here in the good old US of A.
3/7 He tried to overthrow the government and came incredibly close to doing it.
4/7 I remember while it was going on, wondering if the entire US Congress was being executed while we were watching the riot. If the attackers had been somewhat better organized, that's exactly what would have been going on. And how would our country ever recover from that.
5/7 Aside: No one scanned them for weapons as they entered the Capitol.
6/7 The coup didn't work, but that was only luck. The organizers are still free, and they're getting ready for Coup II and this one is going to work. They're using our own laws to pre-rig the outcome of the next national election.
7/7 So to President Biden, who was refreshingly honest and open about Putin (and I don't think it was a gaffe, btw) what are we going to do about the Putinites in America?
@jeremyzilar wow even more impressive. when i guessed correctly i had four letters and i knew the last letter.

If you haven't solved today's Wordle -- this is a spoiler. I was pretty sure I had the answer to today's Wordle, so I did a screen recording of the reveal, to capture the animation, so I could experience it over and over. Now you can too. 😀 https://t.co/wC8QMGFIQa
@jeremyzilar wow that's pretty good, you only had three letters. but you knew the last one.

@Quigs8816 This is a bit different from Iraq. Putin actually has WMDs and has threatened to use them. Yeah it has to be our policy that he goes. Or else there's a new balance of power between the US and Russia.
@Quigs8816 We're just waiting to see what happens in Ukraine before we figure out what the new balance is. But we can't ever "do business" with a Russian leader who threatens to use nukes, unless we're willing to make that threat too.
Putin cannot remain in power.
@lessig I don't get it -- I want Putin gone. I don't see any way out of this mess with him still there. I kind of like that Biden said that.
Any sane person agrees with the president, btw, just sayin, that might enter into your calculations. https://t.co/1dElNRbClF

“I’m fine with opinion: conservative opinion, liberal opinion, but when people start to question the truth — Who won the 2020 election? Was Jan. 6 an insurrection? — I found that unsustainable.” https://t.co/pyU41qKAZ7
Computer desk porn. https://t.co/SXF4PvpnTI
@Super_Grover Yeah I meant something else if you think about it a little you’ll figure it out.
How to Talk to People About a Pandemic. https://t.co/Id9gcv0pHj

You can tell I have hard mode turned off by the row of grey below. I was trying to eliminate a bunch of consonants, and as you can see it worked. I don't think there was a way to solve this one in "hard mode." https://t.co/Gj9w2db8aB
@BeaReno The only way it works is if the mayor doesn’t give a shit about what people think which is what Bloomberg’s secret was.
@BeaReno It’s a shitty job.
Just learned about “hard mode” in Wordle. I have had it turned off. I think it’s bogus.
New York’s mayor faces a backlash over a vaccine exemption for athletes. (People don’t seem to get the pandemic is not over.) https://t.co/JUNKr9jfBl
Twitter is becoming Yahoo.

@alexwilliams @bketelsen I liked Heroku, and added the app-running functionality to my web server, https://t.co/7tk2vhVTaD. I didn't promote it because I just wanted to use the functionality, not support it.
Russian general Yakov Rezantsev killed in Ukraine. https://t.co/vDRC40qQmv
Programmable Notes. https://t.co/RWHuyoOfDs
I imagine Putin watching this and blowing his top. https://t.co/etmNa8Vjoh
